text: Bhesa is a small genus of woody plants in the family Centroplacaceae. Its natural distribution is from southern China to New Guinea. It was formerly classified in Celastraceae, until a molecular phylogenetic study placed it in the family Centroplacaceae in the order Malpighiales. There are eight species: * Bhesa andamanica N.Balach. & Chakrab. * Bhesa archboldiana (Merr. & L.M.Perry) Ding Hou * Bhesa ceylanica (Arn. ex Thwaites) Ding Hou * Bhesa indica (Bedd.) Ding Hou * Bhesa nitidissima Kosterm. * Bhesa paniculata Arn. * Bhesa robusta (Roxb.) Ding Hou * Bhesa sinica (H.T.Chang & Liang) H.T.Chang & Liang ==References== Category:Malpighiales genera Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Bhesa
